Job Posting: 176614 - Position: S26 Full Stack Developer Co-op Student 176614 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/20/2026 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 01/07/2026 10:00 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country WelTel Inc. 828 W 10th Ave Vancouver V5Z 1M9 BC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 Full Stack Developer Co-op Student 176614 Co-op Position Vancouver, BC Canada 8 months In-Person CAD 20.0 per hour for 37.5 Major List Note: This role is funded through the Student Work Placement Program (SWPP), which requires that applicants be Canadian citizens, permanent residents, or persons with refugee protection status. As such, we are unable to accept applications from international students. WelTel - Full Stack Developer Co-op Student Job Type/Length: Full Time Job Location: Vancouver WelTel Incorporated is a Canadian technology start-up with a global commitment to improving the world's health through a digital platform that focuses on patient-centered engagement, virtual care and clinical outpatient management. The company evolved from research that was conducted in response to a public health crisis and out of the Canadian/African. Our vision is to provide the WelTel model of digital health outreach, based on the success of our original HIV research program in Kenya (The Lancet; Lester et al, Nov 2010), to clinical care settings globally, while always striving to reach and include the most remote and vulnerable populations. WelTel accomplishes this by keeping low-cost and far-reaching technologies including text messaging at its core, combined with innovative and practical strategies to improve patient engagement in care and health care workers' ability to deliver the most patient-centered care possible. WelTel's niche is being the only truly evidence-based, digital health outreach tool in the world, realized through technical involvement in high impact clinical trials that help determine the most effective methods of delivering a service that can improve outcomes, save lives and enhance clinical efficiency and management. Results generated through WelTel's clinical trials inform the technology via timely iterations that reflect robust scientific findings, ensuring that the right patient gets the right care at the right time. JOB DESCRIPTION We are looking for a Full Stack Developer Co-op Student to join us in creating interfaces for WelTel's evidence-based virtual care platform. Our ideal candidate has a passion for the work they produce, a drive to grow their knowledge through code-reviews and industry research, and the ability to solve and communicate technical challenges. You will work closely with a team of strategists, designers, and developers to produce online experiences that are user-focused, fully- tested, well-documented, performant, and written with reuse and maintainability in mind. RESPONSIBILITIES • • Demonstrated skills in modern development technologies and tools including some of the following: Bootstrap, REST API. • Technical and design production for WelTel. • Experience with databases, MySQL and cloud compute would be an asset. • Production design assistance with ongoing design projects, including the creation of graphic images and content. • Attend and actively participate in scrum sessions, ensure work is assessed, prioritized and progress updates provided. • Implement responsive web-based user experiences using HTML, CSS, JavaScript or other related technologies based on provided design mockups. • Write clean semantic code, emphasizing performance and usability. • Identify reusable patterns by writing and leveraging component-based code. • Collaborate closely with cross-functional design, UX, development, and strategy teams. • Stay up to date on current and future back-end web development technologies, specifications, and frameworks and make recommendations on when they are appropriate to use. • Perform cross-device QA testing and patching to support multiple browsers, screen sizes, and device types. • Execute other development tasks as defined from time to time. SALARY, WORK HOURS, DURATION, AND ONSITE REQUIREMENTS The position provides an hourly wage of $20, based on a 37.5-hour workweek, with onsite work required for a duration of eight(8) months. ALL TERMS REMAIN UNCHANGED. (For students who demonstrate exceptional performance, an optional four-month extension of the term may be considered through discussion.) Job Requirements SKILLS (Preferred backgrounds/requirements) Canadian Citizen, Permanent Resident or Refugee Status holder. • Co-op student, currently enrolled in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or related program. • Prior co-op or internship experience in a related field is a plus • Knowledge of JavaScript, and familiarity with modern Web frameworks (Angular, React,Vue). • Understanding of the software development life-cycle. • Familiarity with MVC frameworks. • Have a solid understanding of modern back-end development techniques (progressive enhancement, mobile-first development) and cross-browser/platform challenges and solutions. • Strong analytical and problem solving skills. • Strong team player and ability to coordinate tasks. • Able to strategize rapidly and are comfortable presenting your knowledge and ideas to others. Willing to negotiate an "ideal solution" that finds compromises between requirements, budget, user experience, and best practices. • Citizenship Requirement Canadian & Permanent Residents & Refugees Only APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Optional Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions HOW TO APPLY Applicants should submit a resume AND student information summary/Job Application Summary Sheet, clearly indicating how they meet the requirements of the position. Please visit the WelTel Notion page to complete the application form. If you need any assistance with the application, feel free to reach out calla.ng@weltel.org. Applications missing a resume or student information summary will not be considered. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Upon submission, students will receive a confirmation notice from Notion and will have the option to save a copy of their submission. A Notion account is not required to apply; however, students will need one if they wish to retain a copy for their records. APPLICATION LINK: https://circular-kileskus-ff0.notion.site/2634029710f78127b12ae381ee2a93c3 Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
